se.jguru.nazgul.core.reflection.api

Class TypeExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.reflection.api.TypeExtractor

  • public final class TypeExtractor
extends Object
    Type filtering utility class.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Detail

      • getInterfaces

        public static List<Class<?>> getInterfaces(Class<?> clazz,
                                           Filter<Class<?>> selector)
        Acquires all interfaces from the provided class which matches the provided selector's acceptance criteria.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class from which to derive all appropriate interfaces.
        selector - The selector defining which interfaces to filter out.
        Returns:
        All interfaces implemented by the provided class, and which matched the supplied selector's acceptance criteria.

      • getMethods

        public static List<Method> getMethods(Class<?> clazz,
                                      Filter<Method> selector)
        Acquires all methods from the provided class which matches the provided selector.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class from which to retrieve all relevant methods.
        selector - The selector defining which methods to filter out.
        Returns:
        All methods (including private ones) found by the provided class, and which matched the supplied selector's acceptance criteria.

      • getFields

        public static List<Field> getFields(Class<?> clazz,
                                    Filter<Field> selector)
        Acquires all fields from the given class which matches the provided selector.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class from which to retrieve all relevant fields.
        selector - The selector defining which fields to filter out.
        Returns:
        All fields (including private ones) within the provided instance or its superclasses, and which matched the supplied selector's acceptance criteria.

      • getRelationDifference

        public static int getRelationDifference(Class<?> source,
                                        Class<?> target)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Finds the number of types between related classes source and target.
        Parameters:
        source - The source type.
        target - The target type.
        Returns:
        The number of class hops (i.e. class/superclass relations) between the source and target types; if source is a superclass of target, the value is negative, and otherwise positive.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if source and target classes are not related.
